simulation.interaction

Class StandardInteractionRunner

  • java.lang.Object
    • simulation.interaction.StandardInteractionRunner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InteractionRunner

    public class StandardInteractionRunner
extends java.lang.Object
implements InteractionRunner
    A class defining the flow of interactions described in "Evolutionary language competition - an agent-based model" paper. Given an interaction, its flow is as follows. First, the interaction's speaker signals a word denoting given thing (random thing if not given).
    • If the interaction's listener recognizes this word for the given thing, success method is invoked for both the speaker and the listener.
    • If the interaction's listener does not recognize this word for the given thing, loss method is invoked for the speaker, and acquire method is invoked for the listener
    See Also:
    InteractionRunner, ELCPaperSimulationCreator

      • run

        public void run(Speaker speaker,
                Listener listener,
                Thing thing)
        Runs an interaction between the given speaker and the given listener regarding the given thing. Its flow is as follows. First, the speaker signals a word denoting the given thing.
        • If the listener recognizes this word for the given thing, success method is invoked for both the speaker and the listener.
        • If the listener does not recognize this word for the given thing, loss method is invoked for the speaker, and acquire method is invoked for the listener
        Specified by:
        run in interface InteractionRunner
        Parameters:
        speaker - a speaker in the interaction
        listener - a listener in the interaction
        thing - a thing to be the interaction's topic
